properties.description: Amount to be added to the user balance of the specified virtual currency. Maximum VC balance is Int32 (2,147,483,647). Any increase over this value will be discarded.

CatalogItem.name: CatalogItem
CatalogItem.description: A purchasable item from the item catalog

properties.name: Bundle
properties.description: defines the bundle properties for the item - bundles are items which contain other items, including random drop tables and virtual currencies

properties.name: CanBecomeCharacter
properties.description: if true, then an item instance of this type can be used to grant a character to a user.

properties.name: CatalogVersion
properties.description: catalog version for this item

properties.name: Consumable
properties.description: defines the consumable properties (number of uses, timeout) for the item

properties.name: Container
properties.description: defines the container properties for the item - what items it contains, including random drop tables and virtual currencies, and what item (if any) is required to open it via the UnlockContainerItem API

properties.name: CustomData
properties.description: game specific custom data

properties.name: Description
properties.description: text description of item, to show in-game

properties.name: DisplayName
properties.description: text name for the item, to show in-game

properties.name: InitialLimitedEditionCount
properties.description: If the item has IsLImitedEdition set to true, and this is the first time this ItemId has been defined as a limited edition item, this value determines the total number of instances to allocate for the title. Once this limit has been reached, no more instances of this ItemId can be created, and attempts to purchase or grant it will return a Result of false for that ItemId. If the item has already been defined to have a limited edition count, or if this value is less than zero, it will be ignored.

properties.name: IsLimitedEdition
properties.description: BETA: If true, then only a fixed number can ever be granted.

properties.name: IsStackable
properties.description: if true, then only one item instance of this type will exist and its remaininguses will be incremented instead. RemainingUses will cap out at Int32.Max (2,147,483,647). All subsequent increases will be discarded

properties.name: IsTradable
properties.description: if true, then an item instance of this type can be traded between players using the trading APIs

properties.name: ItemClass
properties.description: class to which the item belongs

properties.name: ItemId
properties.description: unique identifier for this item

properties.name: ItemImageUrl
properties.description: URL to the item image. For Facebook purchase to display the image on the item purchase page, this must be set to an HTTP URL.

properties.name: RealCurrencyPrices
properties.description: override prices for this item for specific currencies

properties.name: Tags
properties.description: list of item tags

properties.name: VirtualCurrencyPrices
properties.description: price of this item in virtual currencies and "RM" (the base Real Money purchase price, in USD pennies)

properties.name: BundledItems
properties.description: unique ItemId values for all items which will be added to the player inventory when the bundle is added

properties.name: BundledResultTables
properties.description: unique TableId values for all RandomResultTable objects which are part of the bundle (random tables will be resolved and add the relevant items to the player inventory when the bundle is added)

properties.name: BundledVirtualCurrencies
properties.description: virtual currency types and balances which will be added to the player inventory when the bundle is added

properties.name: UsageCount
properties.description: number of times this object can be used, after which it will be removed from the player inventory

properties.name: UsagePeriod
properties.description: duration in seconds for how long the item will remain in the player inventory - once elapsed, the item will be removed (recommended minimum value is 5 seconds, as lower values can cause the item to expire before operations depending on this item's details have completed)

properties.name: UsagePeriodGroup
properties.description: all inventory item instances in the player inventory sharing a non-null UsagePeriodGroup have their UsagePeriod values added together, and share the result - when that period has elapsed, all the items in the group will be removed

CatalogItemContainerInfo.name: CatalogItemContainerInfo
CatalogItemContainerInfo.description: Containers are inventory items that can hold other items defined in the catalog, as well as virtual currency, which is added to the player inventory when the container is unlocked, using the UnlockContainerItem API. The items can be anything defined in the catalog, as well as RandomResultTable objects which will be resolved when the container is unlocked. Containers and their keys should be defined as Consumable (having a limited number of uses) in their catalog defintiions, unless the intent is for the player to be able to re-use them infinitely.

properties.name: ItemContents
properties.description: unique ItemId values for all items which will be added to the player inventory, once the container has been unlocked

properties.name: KeyItemId
properties.description: ItemId for the catalog item used to unlock the container, if any (if not specified, a call to UnlockContainerItem will open the container, adding the contents to the player inventory and currency balances)

properties.name: ResultTableContents
properties.description: unique TableId values for all RandomResultTable objects which are part of the container (once unlocked, random tables will be resolved and add the relevant items to the player inventory)

properties.name: VirtualCurrencyContents
properties.description: virtual currency types and balances which will be added to the player inventory when the container is unlocked

properties.name: Permanent
properties.description: Whether to make this ban permanent. Set to true to make this ban permanent. This will not modify Active state.

properties.name: Reason
properties.description: The updated reason for the ban to be updated. Maximum 140 characters. Null for no change.

properties.name: Bans
properties.description: List of bans to be updated. Maximum 100.

properties.name: BanData
properties.description: Information on the bans that were updated

properties.name: Catalog
properties.description: Array of catalog items to be submitted. Note that while CatalogItem has a parameter for CatalogVersion, it is not required and ignored in this call.

properties.name: CatalogVersion
properties.description: Which catalog is being updated. If null, uses the default catalog.

properties.name: SetAsDefaultCatalog
properties.description: Should this catalog be set as the default catalog. Defaults to true. If there is currently no default catalog, this will always set it.

properties.name: DeveloperPlayFabId
properties.description: PlayFab user ID of the developer initiating the request.

properties.description: List of Cloud Script files to upload to create the new revision. Must have at least one file.

properties.name: Publish
properties.description: Immediately publish the new revision

properties.name: Version
properties.description: Deprecated - Do not use

properties.name: FriendlyName

properties.name: SecretKey
properties.description: The shared secret key to update

properties.name: AggregationMethod
properties.description: the aggregation method to use in updating the statistic (defaults to last)

properties.name: StatisticName
properties.description: unique name of the statistic

properties.name: VersionChangeInterval
properties.description: interval at which the values of the statistic for all players are reset (changes are effective at the next occurance of the new interval boundary)

properties.name: Statistic
properties.description: updated statistic definition

properties.name: OverwritePolicy
properties.description: Whether to overwrite or append to the existing policy.

properties.name: PolicyName
properties.description: The name of the policy being updated. Only supported name is 'ApiPolicy'

properties.name: Statements
properties.description: The new statements to include in the policy.

properties.name: PolicyName
properties.description: The name of the policy that was updated.

properties.name: Statements
properties.description: The statements included in the new version of the policy.

properties.name: CatalogVersion
properties.description: which catalog is being updated. If null, update the current default catalog version

properties.name: Tables
properties.description: array of random result tables to make available (Note: specifying an existing TableId will result in overwriting that table, while any others will be added to the available set)

properties.name: CatalogVersion
properties.description: Catalog version of the store to update. If null, uses the default catalog.

properties.name: MarketingData
properties.description: Additional data about the store

properties.name: Store

properties.name: StoreId

properties.name: Description
properties.description: Description the task

properties.name: Identifier
properties.description: Specify either the task ID or the name of the task to be updated.

properties.name: IsActive
properties.description: Whether the schedule is active. Inactive schedule will not trigger task execution.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: Name of the task. This is a unique identifier for tasks in the title.

properties.name: Parameter
properties.description: Parameter object specific to the task type. See each task type's create API documentation for details.

properties.name: Schedule
properties.description: Cron expression for the run schedule of the task. The expression should be in UTC.

properties.name: Type
properties.description: Task type.

properties.name: Data
properties.description: Key-value pairs to be written to the custom data. Note that keys are trimmed of whitespace, are limited in size, and may not begin with a '!' character or be null.

properties.name: KeysToRemove
properties.description: Optional list of Data-keys to remove from UserData. Some SDKs cannot insert null-values into Data due to language constraints. Use this to delete the keys directly.

properties.name: Permission
properties.description: Permission to be applied to all user data keys written in this request. Defaults to "private" if not set.

properties.name: PlayFabId

properties.name: DataVersion

calls.name: AbortTaskInstance
calls.summary: Abort an ongoing task instance.
calls.requestDetails: If the task instance has already completed, there will be no-op.

calls.name: AddNews
calls.summary: Adds a new news item to the title's news feed

calls.name: AddPlayerTag
calls.summary: Adds a given tag to a player profile. The tag's namespace is automatically generated based on the source of the tag.
calls.requestDetails: This API will trigger a player_tag_added event and add a tag with the given TagName and PlayFabID to the corresponding player profile. TagName can be used for segmentation and it is limited to 256 characters. Also there is a limit on the number of tags a title can have.

calls.name: AddServerBuild
calls.summary: Adds the game server executable specified (previously uploaded - see GetServerBuildUploadUrl) to the set of those a client is permitted to request in a call to StartGame

calls.name: AddUserVirtualCurrency
calls.summary: Increments the specified virtual currency by the stated amount

calls.name: AddVirtualCurrencyTypes
calls.summary: Adds one or more virtual currencies to the set defined for the title. Virtual Currencies have a maximum value of 2,147,483,647 when granted to a player. Any value over that will be discarded.
calls.requestDetails: This operation is additive. Any new currencies defined in the array will be added to the set of those available for the title, while any CurrencyCode identifiers matching existing ones in the game will be overwritten with the new values.

calls.name: BanUsers
calls.summary: Bans users by PlayFab ID with optional IP address, or MAC address for the provided game.
calls.requestDetails: The existence of each user will not be verified. When banning by IP or MAC address, multiple players may be affected, so use this feature with caution. Returns information about the new bans.

calls.name: CheckLimitedEditionItemAvailability
calls.summary: Checks the global count for the limited edition item.
calls.requestDetails: This returns the total number of these items available.

calls.name: CreateActionsOnPlayersInSegmentTask
calls.summary: Create an ActionsOnPlayersInSegment task, which iterates through all players in a segment to execute action.
calls.requestDetails: Task name is unique within a title. Using a task name that's already taken will cause a name conflict error. Too many create-task requests within a short time will cause a create conflict error.

calls.name: CreateCloudScriptTask
calls.summary: Create a CloudScript task, which can run a CloudScript on a schedule.
calls.requestDetails: Task name is unique within a title. Using a task name that's already taken will cause a name conflict error. Too many create-task requests within a short time will cause a create conflict error.

calls.name: CreatePlayerSharedSecret
calls.summary: Creates a new Player Shared Secret Key. It may take up to 5 minutes for this key to become generally available after this API returns.
calls.requestDetails: Player Shared Secret Keys are used for the call to Client/GetTitlePublicKey, which exchanges the shared secret for an RSA CSP blob to be used to encrypt the payload of account creation requests when that API requires a signature header.

calls.name: CreatePlayerStatisticDefinition
calls.summary: Adds a new player statistic configuration to the title, optionally allowing the developer to specify a reset interval and an aggregation method.
calls.requestDetails: Statistics are numeric values, with each statistic in the title also generating a leaderboard. The ResetInterval enables automatically resetting leaderboards on a specified interval. Upon reset, the statistic updates to a new version with no values (effectively removing all players from the leaderboard). The previous version's statistic values are also archived for retrieval, if needed (see GetPlayerStatisticVersions). Statistics not created via a call to CreatePlayerStatisticDefinition by default have a VersionChangeInterval of Never, meaning they do not reset on a schedule, but they can be set to do so via a call to UpdatePlayerStatisticDefinition. Once a statistic has been reset (sometimes referred to as versioned or incremented), the now-previous version can still be written to for up a short, pre-defined period (currently 10 seconds), to prevent issues with levels completing around the time of the reset. Also, once reset, the historical statistics for players in the title may be retrieved using the URL specified in the version information (GetPlayerStatisticVersions). The AggregationMethod determines what action is taken when a new statistic value is submitted - always update with the new value (Last), use the highest of the old and new values (Max), use the smallest (Min), or add them together (Sum).

calls.name: DeleteContent
calls.summary: Delete a content file from the title. When deleting a file that does not exist, it returns success.

calls.name: DeletePlayer
calls.summary: Removes a user's player account from a title and deletes all associated data
calls.requestDetails: Deletes all data associated with the player, including statistics, custom data, inventory, purchases, virtual currency balances,         characters and shared group memberships. Removes the player from all leaderboards and player search indexes. Does not delete PlayStream event history associated with the player.         Does not delete the publisher user account that created the player in the title nor associated data such as username, password, email address, account linkages, or friends list.         Note, this API queues the player for deletion and returns immediately. It may take several minutes or more before all player data is fully deleted.         Until the player data is fully deleted, attempts to recreate the player with the same user account in the same title will fail with the 'AccountDeleted' error.

calls.name: DeletePlayerSharedSecret
calls.summary: Deletes an existing Player Shared Secret Key. It may take up to 5 minutes for this delete to be reflected after this API returns.
calls.requestDetails: Player Shared Secret Keys are used for the call to Client/GetTitlePublicKey, which exchanges the shared secret for an RSA CSP blob to be used to encrypt the payload of account creation requests when that API requires a signature header.

calls.name: DeleteStore
calls.summary: Deletes an existing virtual item store
calls.requestDetails: This non-reversible operation will permanently delete the requested store.

calls.name: DeleteTask
calls.summary: Delete a task.
calls.requestDetails: After a task is deleted, for tracking purposes, the task instances belonging to this task will still remain. They will become orphaned and does not belongs to any task. Executions of any in-progress task instances will continue. If the task specified does not exist, the deletion is considered a success.

calls.name: DeleteTitle
calls.summary: Permanently deletes a title and all associated configuration
calls.requestDetails: Deletes all data associated with the title, including catalog, virtual currencies, leaderboard statistics, Cloud Script revisions,         segment definitions, event rules, tasks, add-ons, secret keys, data encryption keys, and permission policies.         Removes the title from its studio and removes all associated developer roles and permissions.         Does not delete PlayStream event history associated with the title.         Note, this API queues the title for deletion and returns immediately. It may take several hours or more before all title data is fully deleted.         All player accounts in the title must be deleted before deleting the title. If any player accounts exist, the API will return a 'TitleContainsUserAccounts' error.                 Until the title data is fully deleted, attempts to call APIs with the title will fail with the 'TitleDeleted' error.

calls.name: DeleteUsers
calls.summary: Deletes the users for the provided game. Deletes custom data, all account linkages, and statistics. This method does not remove the player's event history, login history, inventory items, nor virtual currencies.
calls.requestDetails: Note that this action cannot be undone. It will unlink all accounts and remove all PII information, as well as reset any statistics and leaderboards and clear out any stored custom data for the user.

calls.name: GetActionsOnPlayersInSegmentTaskInstance
calls.summary: Get information about a ActionsOnPlayersInSegment task instance.
calls.requestDetails: The result includes detail information that's specific to an ActionsOnPlayersInSegment task. To get a list of task instances with generic basic information, use GetTaskInstances.

calls.name: GetAllActionGroups
calls.summary: Retrieve a list of all PlayStream actions groups.

calls.name: GetAllSegments
calls.summary: Retrieves an array of player segment definitions. Results from this can be used in subsequent API calls such as GetPlayersInSegment which requires a Segment ID. While segment names can change the ID for that segment will not change.
calls.requestDetails: Request has no paramaters.

        "ItemClass": "Containers",

        "DisplayName": "Item Container 2",
        "Description": "Item which, when opened (no key needed), adds the items it holds to the user inventory",
        "VirtualCurrencyPrices": {
          "RM": 99
        },
        "Consumable": {
          "UsageCount": 1
        },
        "Container": {
          "VirtualCurrencyContents": {
            "GV": 1000
          }
        },
        "CanBecomeCharacter": false,
        "IsStackable": false,
        "IsTradable": false,
        "IsLimitedEdition": false,
        "InitialLimitedEditionCount": 0
      },
      {
        "ItemId": "starterpack_1",
        "ItemClass": "starterpacks",
        "CatalogVersion": "5",
        "DisplayName": "Super Starter Pack",
        "Description": "Everything you need to get started fast track at the right price",
        "CanBecomeCharacter": false,
        "IsStackable": false,
        "IsTradable": false,
        "IsLimitedEdition": false,
        "InitialLimitedEditionCount": 0
      }
    ]
  }
}

calls.name: GetCloudScriptRevision
calls.summary: Gets the contents and information of a specific Cloud Script revision.

calls.name: GetCloudScriptTaskInstance
calls.summary: Get detail information about a CloudScript task instance.
calls.requestDetails: The result includes detail information that's specific to a CloudScript tasks. To get a list of task instances with generic basic information, use GetTaskInstances.

calls.name: GetCloudScriptVersions
calls.summary: Lists all the current cloud script versions. For each version, information about the current published and latest revisions is also listed.

calls.name: GetContentList
calls.summary: List all contents of the title and get statistics such as size

calls.name: GetContentUploadUrl
calls.summary: Retrieves the pre-signed URL for uploading a content file. A subsequent HTTP PUT to the returned URL uploads the content. Also, please be aware that the Content service is specifically PlayFab's CDN offering, for which standard CDN rates apply.

calls.name: GetDataReport
calls.summary: Retrieves a download URL for the requested report
calls.requestDetails: Gets the download URL for the requested report data (in CSV form). The reports available through this API call are those available in the Game Manager, in the Analytics->Reports tab.

calls.name: GetMatchmakerGameInfo
calls.summary: Retrieves the details for a specific completed session, including links to standard out and standard error logs

calls.name: GetMatchmakerGameModes
calls.summary: Retrieves the details of defined game modes for the specified game server executable
calls.requestDetails: These details are used by the PlayFab matchmaking service to determine if an existing Game Server Instance has room for additional users, and by the PlayFab game server management service to determine when a new Game Server Host should be created in order to prevent excess load on existing Hosts.

calls.name: GetPlayerIdFromAuthToken
calls.summary: Gets a player's ID from an auth token.
calls.requestDetails: Gets a player ID from an auth token. The token expires after 30 minutes and cannot be used to look up a player when expired.

calls.name: GetPlayerProfile
calls.summary: Retrieves the player's profile
calls.requestDetails: This API allows for access to details regarding a user in the PlayFab service, usually for purposes of customer support. Note that data returned may be Personally Identifying Information (PII), such as email address, and so care should be taken in how this data is stored and managed. Since this call will always return the relevant information for users who have accessed the title, the recommendation is to not store this data locally.

calls.name: GetPlayerSegments
calls.summary: List all segments that a player currently belongs to at this moment in time.

calls.name: GetPlayerSharedSecrets
calls.summary: Returns all Player Shared Secret Keys including disabled and expired.
calls.requestDetails: Player Shared Secret Keys are used for the call to Client/GetTitlePublicKey, which exchanges the shared secret for an RSA CSP blob to be used to encrypt the payload of account creation requests when that API requires a signature header.

calls.name: GetPlayersInSegment
calls.summary: Allows for paging through all players in a given segment. This API creates a snapshot of all player profiles that match the segment definition at the time of its creation and lives through the Total Seconds to Live, refreshing its life span on each subsequent use of the Continuation Token. Profiles that change during the course of paging will not be reflected in the results. AB Test segments are currently not supported by this operation.
calls.requestDetails: Initial request must contain at least a Segment ID. Subsequent requests must contain the Segment ID as well as the Continuation Token. Failure to send the Continuation Token will result in a new player segment list being generated. Each time the Continuation Token is passed in the length of the Total Seconds to Live is refreshed. If too much time passes between requests to the point that a subsequent request is past the Total Seconds to Live an error will be returned and paging will be terminated. This API is resource intensive and should not be used in scenarios which might generate high request volumes. Only one request to this API at a time should be made per title. Concurrent requests to the API may be rejected with the APIConcurrentRequestLimitExceeded error.

calls.name: GetPlayerStatisticDefinitions
calls.summary: Retrieves the configuration information for all player statistics defined in the title, regardless of whether they have a reset interval.
calls.resultDetails: Statistics are numeric values, with each statistic in the title also generating a leaderboard. The ResetInterval defines the period of time at which the leaderboard for the statistic will automatically reset. Upon reset, the statistic updates to a new version with no values (effectively removing all players from the leaderboard). The previous version's statistic values are also archived for retrieval, if needed (see GetPlayerStatisticVersions). Statistics not created via a call to CreatePlayerStatisticDefinition by default have a VersionChangeInterval of Never, meaning they do not reset on a schedule, but they can be set to do so via a call to UpdatePlayerStatisticDefinition. Once a statistic has been reset (sometimes referred to as versioned or incremented), the previous version can still be written to for up a short, pre-defined period (currently 10 seconds), to prevent issues with levels completing around the time of the reset. Also, once reset, the historical statistics for players in the title may be retrieved using the URL specified in the version information (GetPlayerStatisticVersions). The AggregationMethod defines what action is taken when a new statistic value is submitted - always update with the new value (Last), use the highest of the old and new values (Max), use the smallest (Min), or add them together (Sum).

calls.name: GetPlayerStatisticVersions
calls.summary: Retrieves the information on the available versions of the specified statistic.
calls.resultDetails: Statistics are numeric values, with each statistic in the title also generating a leaderboard. The information returned in the results defines the state of a specific version of a statistic, including when it was or will become the currently active version, when it will (or did) become a previous version, and its archival state if it is no longer the active version. For a statistic which has been reset, once the archival status is Complete, the full set of statistics for all players in the leaderboard for that version may be retrieved via the ArchiveDownloadUrl. Statistics which have not been reset (incremented/versioned) will only have a single version which is not scheduled to reset.

calls.name: GetPlayerTags
calls.summary: Get all tags with a given Namespace (optional) from a player profile.
calls.requestDetails: This API will return a list of canonical tags which includes both namespace and tag's name. If namespace is not provided, the result is a list of all canonical tags. TagName can be used for segmentation and Namespace is limited to 128 characters.

calls.name: GetPolicy
calls.summary: Gets the requested policy.
calls.requestDetails: Views the requested policy. Today, the only supported policy is 'ApiPolicy'.

calls.name: GetPublisherData
calls.summary: Retrieves the key-value store of custom publisher settings
calls.requestDetails: This API is designed to return publisher-specific values which can be read, but not written to, by the client. This data is shared across all titles assigned to a particular publisher, and can be used for cross-game coordination. Only titles assigned to a publisher can use this API. For more information email devrel@playfab.com. This AdminAPI call for getting title data guarantees no delay in between update and retrieval of newly set data.

calls.name: GetRandomResultTables
calls.summary: Retrieves the random drop table configuration for the title

calls.name: GetServerBuildInfo
calls.summary: Retrieves the build details for the specified game server executable

calls.name: GetServerBuildUploadUrl
calls.summary: Retrieves the pre-authorized URL for uploading a game server package containing a build (does not enable the build for use - see AddServerBuild)

calls.name: GetStoreItems
calls.summary: Retrieves the set of items defined for the specified store, including all prices defined
calls.requestDetails: A store contains an array of references to items defined in the catalog, along with the prices for the item, in both real world and virtual currencies. These prices act as an override to any prices defined in the catalog. In this way, the base definitions of the items may be defined in the catalog, with all associated properties, while the pricing can be set for each store, as needed. This allows for subsets of goods to be defined for different purposes (in order to simplify showing some, but not all catalog items to users, based upon different characteristics), along with unique prices. Note that all prices defined in the catalog and store definitions for the item are considered valid, and that a compromised client can be made to send a request for an item based upon any of these definitions. If no price is specified in the store for an item, the price set in the catalog should be displayed to the user.

calls.name: GetTaskInstances
calls.summary: Query for task instances by task, status, or time range.
calls.requestDetails: Only the most recent 100 task instances are returned, ordered by start time descending. The results are generic basic information for task instances. To get detail information specific to each task type, use Get*TaskInstance based on its corresponding task type.

calls.name: GetTasks
calls.summary: Get definition information on a specified task or all tasks within a title.

calls.name: GetTitleData
calls.summary: Retrieves the key-value store of custom title settings which can be read by the client
calls.requestDetails: This API method is designed to return title specific values which can be read by the client. For example, a developer could choose to store values which modify the user experience, such as enemy spawn rates, weapon strengths, movement speeds, etc. This allows a developer to update the title without the need to create,test, and ship a new build. Note that due to caching, there may up to a minute delay in between updating title data and a query returning the newest value.

calls.name: GetTitleInternalData
calls.summary: Retrieves the key-value store of custom title settings which cannot be read by the client
calls.requestDetails: This API method is designed to return title specific values which are accessible only by the server. These values can be used to tweak settings used by game servers and Cloud Scripts without the need to update and re-deploy. Note that due to caching, there may up to a minute delay in between updating title data and this query returning the newest value.

calls.name: GetUserAccountInfo
calls.summary: Retrieves the relevant details for a specified user, based upon a match against a supplied unique identifier
calls.requestDetails: This API allows for access to details regarding a user in the PlayFab service, usually for purposes of customer support. Note that data returned may be Personally Identifying Information (PII), such as email address, and so care should be taken in how this data is stored and managed. Since this call will always return the relevant information for users who have accessed the title, the recommendation is to not store this data locally.

calls.name: GetUserBans
calls.summary: Gets all bans for a user.
calls.requestDetails: Get all bans for a user, including inactive and expired bans.

calls.name: GetUserData
calls.summary: Retrieves the title-specific custom data for the user which is readable and writable by the client
calls.requestDetails: Data is stored as JSON key-value pairs. If the Keys parameter is provided, the data object returned will only contain the data specific to the indicated Keys. Otherwise, the full set of custom user data will be returned.

calls.name: GetUserInternalData
calls.summary: Retrieves the title-specific custom data for the user which cannot be accessed by the client
calls.requestDetails: Data is stored as JSON key-value pairs. If the Keys parameter is provided, the data object returned will only contain the data specific to the indicated Keys. Otherwise, the full set of custom user data will be returned.

calls.name: GetUserInventory
calls.summary: Retrieves the specified user's current inventory of virtual goods
calls.requestDetails: All items currently in the user inventory will be returned, irrespective of how they were acquired (via purchasing, grants, coupons, etc.). Items that are expired, fully consumed, or are no longer valid are not considered to be in the user's current inventory, and so will not be not included.

calls.name: GetUserPublisherData
calls.summary: Retrieves the publisher-specific custom data for the user which is readable and writable by the client
calls.requestDetails: Data is stored as JSON key-value pairs. If the Keys parameter is provided, the data object returned will only contain the data specific to the indicated Keys. Otherwise, the full set of custom user data will be returned.

calls.name: GetUserPublisherInternalData
calls.summary: Retrieves the publisher-specific custom data for the user which cannot be accessed by the client
calls.requestDetails: Data is stored as JSON key-value pairs. If the Keys parameter is provided, the data object returned will only contain the data specific to the indicated Keys. Otherwise, the full set of custom user data will be returned.

calls.name: GetUserPublisherReadOnlyData
calls.summary: Retrieves the publisher-specific custom data for the user which can only be read by the client
calls.requestDetails: Data is stored as JSON key-value pairs. If the Keys parameter is provided, the data object returned will only contain the data specific to the indicated Keys. Otherwise, the full set of custom user data will be returned.

calls.name: GetUserReadOnlyData
calls.summary: Retrieves the title-specific custom data for the user which can only be read by the client
calls.requestDetails: Data is stored as JSON key-value pairs. If the Keys parameter is provided, the data object returned will only contain the data specific to the indicated Keys. Otherwise, the full set of custom user data will be returned.

calls.name: GrantItemsToUsers
calls.summary: Adds the specified items to the specified user inventories
calls.requestDetails: This function directly adds inventory items to user inventories. As a result of this operations, the user will not be charged any transaction fee, regardless of the inventory item catalog definition. Please note that the processing time for inventory grants and purchases increases fractionally the more items are in the inventory, and the more items are in the grant/purchase operation.
calls.resultDetails: Please note that the order of the items in the response may not match the order of items in the request.
calls.resultExample:
{
  "code": 200,
  "status": "OK",
  "data": {
    "ItemGrantResults": [
      {
        "PlayFabId": "20394883",
        "Result": true,
        "ItemId": "shield_level_1",
        "ItemInstanceId": "133713371337",
        "ItemClass": "shields",
        "PurchaseDate": "2017-03-07T00:00:00Z",
        "Expiration": "2018-10-01T00:00:00Z",
        "RemainingUses": 10,
        "Annotation": "Entered Level 2",
        "CatalogVersion": "5",
        "BundleParent": "crate block 1",
        "UnitPrice": 0
      },
      {
        "PlayFabId": "20394883",
        "Result": true,
        "ItemId": "shield_level_2",
        "ItemInstanceId": "133713371337",
        "ItemClass": "shields",
        "PurchaseDate": "2017-03-07T00:00:00Z",
        "Expiration": "2018-10-01T00:00:00Z",
        "RemainingUses": 10,
        "Annotation": "Entered Level 2",
        "CatalogVersion": "5",
        "BundleParent": "crate block 1",
        "UnitPrice": 0,
        "CustomData": {
          "Equipped": "True",
          "Slot": "Head"
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}

calls.name: IncrementLimitedEditionItemAvailability
calls.summary: Increases the global count for the given scarce resource.
calls.requestDetails: This operation will increment the global counter for the number of these items available. This number cannot be decremented, except by actual grants.

calls.name: IncrementPlayerStatisticVersion
calls.summary: Resets the indicated statistic, removing all player entries for it and backing up the old values.
calls.requestDetails: Statistics are numeric values, with each statistic in the title also generating a leaderboard. When this call is made on a given statistic, this forces a reset of that statistic. Upon reset, the statistic updates to a new version with no values (effectively removing all players from the leaderboard). The previous version's statistic values are also archived for retrieval, if needed (see GetPlayerStatisticVersions). Statistics not created via a call to CreatePlayerStatisticDefinition by default have a VersionChangeInterval of Never, meaning they do not reset on a schedule, but they can be set to do so via a call to UpdatePlayerStatisticDefinition. Once a statistic has been reset (sometimes referred to as versioned or incremented), the now-previous version can still be written to for up a short, pre-defined period (currently 10 seconds), to prevent issues with levels completing around the time of the reset. Also, once reset, the historical statistics for players in the title may be retrieved using the URL specified in the version information (GetPlayerStatisticVersions).

calls.name: ListServerBuilds
calls.summary: Retrieves the build details for all game server executables which are currently defined for the title

calls.name: ListVirtualCurrencyTypes
calls.summary: Retuns the list of all defined virtual currencies for the title

calls.name: ModifyMatchmakerGameModes
calls.summary: Updates the game server mode details for the specified game server executable
calls.requestDetails: These details are used by the PlayFab matchmaking service to determine if an existing Game Server Instance has room for additional users, and by the PlayFab game server management service to determine when a new Game Server Host should be created in order to prevent excess load on existing Hosts. This operation is not additive. Using it will cause the game mode definition for the game server executable in question to be created from scratch. If there is an existing game server mode definition for the given BuildVersion, it will be deleted and replaced with the data specified in this call.

calls.name: ModifyServerBuild
calls.summary: Updates the build details for the specified game server executable

calls.name: RefundPurchase
calls.summary: Attempts to process an order refund through the original real money payment provider.
calls.remarks: The Reason parameter should correspond with the payment providers reason field, if they require one such as Facebook.

calls.name: RemovePlayerTag
calls.summary: Remove a given tag from a player profile. The tag's namespace is automatically generated based on the source of the tag.
calls.requestDetails: This API will trigger a player_tag_removed event and remove a tag with the given TagName and PlayFabID from the corresponding player profile. TagName can be used for segmentation and it is limited to 256 characters

calls.name: RemoveServerBuild
calls.summary: Removes the game server executable specified from the set of those a client is permitted to request in a call to StartGame

calls.name: RemoveVirtualCurrencyTypes
calls.summary: Removes one or more virtual currencies from the set defined for the title.
calls.requestDetails: Virtual currencies to be removed cannot have entries in any catalog nor store for the title. Note that this operation will not remove player balances for the removed currencies; if a deleted currency is recreated at any point, user balances will be in an undefined state.

calls.name: ResetCharacterStatistics
calls.summary: Completely removes all statistics for the specified character, for the current game
calls.requestDetails: Note that this action cannot be un-done. All statistics for this character will be deleted, removing the user from all leaderboards for the game.

calls.name: ResetPassword
calls.summary: Reset a player's password for a given title.
calls.requestDetails: Resets a player's password taking in a new password based and validating the user based off of a token sent to the playerto their email. The token expires after 30 minutes.

calls.name: ResetUsers
calls.summary: Resets all title-specific information about a particular account, including user data, virtual currency balances, inventory, purchase history, and statistics
calls.requestDetails: This method is intended for use with test accounts, to allow a developer to reset and test a game experience from the start. Note that in order to reset an account, you must know the username. If the account does not have a username, you must add one with AddUsernamePassword in the client API prior to calling this method.

calls.name: ResetUserStatistics
calls.summary: Completely removes all statistics for the specified user, for the current game
calls.requestDetails: Note that this action cannot be un-done. All statistics for this user will be deleted, removing the user from all leaderboards for the game.

calls.name: ResolvePurchaseDispute
calls.summary: Attempts to resolve a dispute with the original order's payment provider.
calls.remarks: The Reason parameter should correspond with the payment providers reason field, if they require one such as Facebook.

calls.name: RevokeAllBansForUser
calls.summary: Revoke all active bans for a user.
calls.requestDetails: Setting the active state of all non-expired bans for a user to Inactive. Expired bans with an Active state will be ignored, however. Returns information about applied updates only.

calls.name: RevokeBans
calls.summary: Revoke all active bans specified with BanId.
calls.requestDetails: Setting the active state of all bans requested to Inactive regardless of whether that ban has already expired. BanIds that do not exist will be skipped. Returns information about applied updates only.

calls.name: RevokeInventoryItem
calls.summary: Revokes access to an item in a user's inventory
calls.requestDetails: In cases where the inventory item in question is a "crate", and the items it contained have already been dispensed, this will not revoke access or otherwise remove the items which were dispensed.

calls.name: RevokeInventoryItems
calls.summary: Revokes access for up to 25 items across multiple users and characters.
calls.requestDetails: In cases where the inventory item in question is a "crate", and the items it contained have already been dispensed, this will not revoke access or otherwise remove the items which were dispensed.

calls.name: RunTask
calls.summary: Run a task immediately regardless of its schedule.
calls.requestDetails: The returned task instance ID can be used to query for task execution status.

calls.name: SendAccountRecoveryEmail
calls.summary: Forces an email to be sent to the registered email address for the user's account, with a link allowing the user to change the password.If an account recovery email template ID is provided, an email using the custom email template will be used.
calls.requestDetails: If the account in question is a "temporary" account (for example, one that was created via a call to LoginFromIOSDeviceID), thisfunction will have no effect. Only PlayFab accounts which have valid email addresses will be able to receive a password reset email using this API.

calls.name: SetCatalogItems
calls.summary: Creates the catalog configuration of all virtual goods for the specified catalog version
calls.requestDetails: This operation is not additive. Using it will cause the indicated catalog version to be created from scratch. If there is an existing catalog with the version number in question, it will be deleted and replaced with only the items specified in this call.

calls.name: SetPlayerSecret
calls.summary: Sets or resets the player's secret. Player secrets are used to sign API requests.
calls.requestDetails: APIs that require signatures require that the player have a configured Player Secret Key that is used to sign all requests. Players that don't have a secret will be blocked from making API calls until it is configured. To create a signature header add a SHA256 hashed string containing UTF8 encoded JSON body as it will be sent to the server, the current time in UTC formatted to ISO 8601, and the players secret formatted as 'body.date.secret'. Place the resulting hash into the header X-PlayFab-Signature, along with a header X-PlayFab-Timestamp of the same UTC timestamp used in the signature.

calls.name: SetPublishedRevision
calls.summary: Sets the currently published revision of a title Cloud Script

calls.name: SetPublisherData
calls.summary: Updates the key-value store of custom publisher settings
calls.requestDetails: This API is designed to store publisher-specific values which can be read, but not written to, by the client. This data is shared across all titles assigned to a particular publisher, and can be used for cross-game coordination. Only titles assigned to a publisher can use this API. This operation is additive. If a Key does not exist in the current dataset, it will be added with the specified Value. If it already exists, the Value for that key will be overwritten with the new Value. For more information email devrel@playfab.com

calls.name: SetStoreItems
calls.summary: Sets all the items in one virtual store
calls.requestDetails: This operation is not additive. Using it will cause the indicated virtual store to be created from scratch. If there is an existing store with the same storeId, it will be deleted and replaced with only the items specified in this call. A store contains an array of references to items defined inthe catalog, along with the prices for the item, in both real world and virtual currencies. These prices act as an override to any prices defined in the catalog. In this way, the base definitions of the items may be defined in the catalog, with all associated properties, while the pricing can be set for each store, as needed. This allows for subsets of goods to be defined for different purposes (in order to simplify showing some, but not all catalog items to users, based upon different characteristics), along with unique prices. Note that all prices defined in the catalog and store definitions for the item are considered valid, and that a compromised client can be made to send a request for an item based upon any of these definitions. If no price is specified in the store for an item, the price set in the catalog should be displayed to the user.

calls.name: SetTitleData
calls.summary: Creates and updates the key-value store of custom title settings which can be read by the client
calls.requestDetails: This API method is designed to store title specific values which can be read by the client. For example, a developer could choose to store values which modify the user experience, such as enemy spawn rates, weapon strengths, movement speeds, etc. This allows a developer to update the title without the need to create, test, and ship a new build. This operation is additive. If a Key does not exist in the current dataset, it will be added with the specified Value. If it already exists, the Value for that key will be overwritten with the new Value.

calls.name: SetTitleInternalData
calls.summary: Updates the key-value store of custom title settings which cannot be read by the client
calls.requestDetails: This API method is designed to store title specific values which are accessible only by the server. These values can be used to tweak settings used by game servers and Cloud Scripts without the need to update and re-deploy. This operation is additive. If a Key does not exist in the current dataset, it will be added with the specified Value. If it already exists, the Value for that key will be overwritten with the new Value.

calls.name: SetupPushNotification
calls.summary: Sets the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for iOS and Android push notifications. Documentation on the exact restrictions can be found at: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/sns/latest/api/API_CreatePlatformApplication.html. Currently, Amazon device Messaging is not supported.
calls.requestDetails: When using the Apple Push Notification service (APNS) or the development version (APNS_SANDBOX), the APNS Private Key should be used as the Credential in this call. With Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), the Android API Key should be used. The current ARN (if one exists) can be overwritten by setting the OverwriteOldARN boolean to true.

calls.name: SubtractUserVirtualCurrency
calls.summary: Decrements the specified virtual currency by the stated amount

calls.name: UpdateBans
calls.summary: Updates information of a list of existing bans specified with Ban Ids.
calls.requestDetails: For each ban, only updates the values that are set. Leave any value to null for no change. If a ban could not be found, the rest are still applied. Returns information about applied updates only.

calls.name: UpdateCatalogItems
calls.summary: Updates the catalog configuration for virtual goods in the specified catalog version
calls.requestDetails: This operation is additive. Items with ItemId values not currently in the catalog will be added, while those with ItemId values matching items currently in the catalog will overwrite those items with the given values.

calls.name: UpdateCloudScript
calls.summary: Creates a new Cloud Script revision and uploads source code to it. Note that at this time, only one file should be submitted in the revision.

calls.name: UpdatePlayerSharedSecret
calls.summary: Updates a existing Player Shared Secret Key. It may take up to 5 minutes for this update to become generally available after this API returns.
calls.requestDetails: Player Shared Secret Keys are used for the call to Client/GetTitlePublicKey, which exchanges the shared secret for an RSA CSP blob to be used to encrypt the payload of account creation requests when that API requires a signature header.

calls.name: UpdatePlayerStatisticDefinition
calls.summary: Updates a player statistic configuration for the title, optionally allowing the developer to specify a reset interval.
calls.requestDetails: Statistics are numeric values, with each statistic in the title also generating a leaderboard. The ResetInterval enables automatically resetting leaderboards on a specified interval. Upon reset, the statistic updates to a new version with no values (effectively removing all players from the leaderboard). The previous version's statistic values are also archived for retrieval, if needed (see GetPlayerStatisticVersions). Statistics not created via a call to CreatePlayerStatisticDefinition by default have a VersionChangeInterval of Never, meaning they do not reset on a schedule, but they can be set to do so via a call to UpdatePlayerStatisticDefinition. Once a statistic has been reset (sometimes referred to as versioned or incremented), the now-previous version can still be written to for up a short, pre-defined period (currently 10 seconds), to prevent issues with levels completing around the time of the reset. Also, once reset, the historical statistics for players in the title may be retrieved using the URL specified in the version information (GetPlayerStatisticVersions). The AggregationMethod determines what action is taken when a new statistic value is submitted - always update with the new value (Last), use the highest of the old and new values (Max), use the smallest (Min), or add them together (Sum).

calls.name: UpdatePolicy
calls.summary: Changes a policy for a title
calls.requestDetails: Updates permissions for your title. Policies affect what is allowed to happen on your title. Your policy is a collection of statements that, together, govern particular area for your title. Today, the only allowed policy is called 'ApiPolicy' and it governs what calls players are allowed to make.

calls.name: UpdateRandomResultTables
calls.summary: Updates the random drop table configuration for the title
calls.requestDetails: This operation is additive. Tables with TableId values not currently defined will be added, while those with TableId values matching Tables currently in the catalog will be overwritten with the given values.

calls.name: UpdateStoreItems
calls.summary: Updates an existing virtual item store with new or modified items
calls.requestDetails: This operation is additive. Items with ItemId values not currently in the store will be added, while those with ItemId values matching items currently in the catalog will overwrite those items with the given values. A store contains an array of references to items defined in the catalog, along with the prices for the item, in both real world and virtual currencies. These prices act as an override to any prices defined in the catalog. In this way, the base definitions of the items may be defined in the catalog, with all associated properties, while the pricing can be set for each store, as needed. This allows for subsets of goods to be defined for different purposes (in order to simplify showing some, but not all catalog items to users, based upon different characteristics), along with unique prices. Note that all prices defined in the catalog and store definitions for the item are considered valid, and that a compromised client can be made to send a request for an item based upon any of these definitions. If no price is specified in the store for an item, the price set in the catalog should be displayed to the user.

calls.name: UpdateTask
calls.summary: Update an existing task.
calls.requestDetails: Note that when calling this API, all properties of the task have to be provided, including properties that you do not want to change. Parameters not specified would be set to default value. If the task name in the update request is new, a task rename operation will be executed before updating other fields of the task. WARNING: Renaming of a task may break logics where the task name is used as an identifier.

calls.name: UpdateUserData
calls.summary: Updates the title-specific custom data for the user which is readable and writable by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, while keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

calls.name: UpdateUserInternalData
calls.summary: Updates the title-specific custom data for the user which cannot be accessed by the client
calls.requestDetails: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call. Note that in the example call provided, title-specific data is used, as there may be a need to share this across titles (in sequels, for example).

calls.name: UpdateUserTitleDisplayName
calls.summary: Updates the title specific display name for a user
calls.requestDetails: In addition to the PlayFab username, titles can make use of a DisplayName which is also a unique identifier, but specific to the title. This allows for unique names which more closely match the theme or genre of a title, for example. This API enables changing that name, whether due to a customer request, an offensive name choice, etc.
